titleStmt.title: Anno Regni Caroli II regis Angliæ, Scotiæ, Franciæ, & Hiberniæ tricesimo. At the Parliament begun at Westminster the eighth day of May, anno Dom. 1661, in the thirteenth year of the reign of our Soveraign Lord Charles, by the grace of God, of England, Scotland, France, and Ireland King, Defender of the Faith, &c. : and by several prorogations and adjournments there continued to the 30th day of November in the 30th year of his Majesties reign, on which day the following act passed the royal assent.
Act for the more effectual preserving the Kings person and government, by disabling papists from sitting in either house of Parliament
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament.

titleStmt.title: Anno Regni Caroli II regis Angliæ, Scotiæ, Franciæ, & Hiberniæ tricesimo. At the Parliament begun at Westminster the eighth day of May, anno Dom. 1661, in the thirteenth year of the reign of our Soveraign Lord Charles, by the grace of God, of England, Scotland, France, and Ireland King, Defender of the Faith, &c. : and by several prorogations and adjournments there continued to the 30th day of November in the 30th year of his Majesties reign, on which day the following act passed the royal assent.
Act for the more effectual preserving the Kings person and government, by disabling papists from sitting in either house of Parliament
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament.

publicationStmt.publisher: Re-printed by the heir of Andrew Anderson, Printer to his most sacred Majesty,

notesStmt.note: Title vignette: royal arms with initials "C R".
Reproduction of the original in the National Library of Scotland.
